title: Best Horror Games To Watch Or Stream On Twitch For Halloween
description: By     Mark Delaney   on October 27, 2025 at 2:55PM PDT                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    Mark Delaney
   on October 27, 2025 at 2:55PM PDT    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Horror is my everything. You'll rarely catch me at a time in my life when I'm not reading, watching, or playing something in the genre. If you can relate, then you surely also love the Halloween season, because it's a time when so many others try to match your vibe, if only for a few weeks. Even for folks too scared to play horror games themselves, many like to watch others play them on Twitch. During the Halloween season, Twitch itself gets in on the action with its annual Fright Fest, which is back for 2025. You can read about everything going on in Twitch Fright Fest 2025 on the official website.With all that in mind, we've put together a list of the six best horror games to watch or stream on Twitch. Whether you are hosting the playthrough for your viewers or letting someone else do the dirty work of facing down the terrors that pursue them, below you'll find a half-dozen scary games that fit snugly in the Twitch world, for both creators and their audiences.For even more horror content, don't miss our lists of the best multiplayer horror games, the best gateway horror games (for genre newcomers), and, of course, the best horror games in general.Silent Hill FPlatforms: PC, Xbox Series X|S, PS5Silent Hill f is both the newest game on this list and part of the oldest series mentioned herein. Dating back to 1999, Silent Hill has been a household name in horror games for decades. The series once seemed unlikely to ever return, after going quiet following the cancellation of Silent Hills in 2014. But it has since roared back with an incredible remake of Silent Hill 2 last year, followed by this fresh take on the series that moves it out of small-town America to 1960s Japan, which really lets it explore new themes and aesthetics. This is a great streaming pick because the story actually takes multiple playthroughs to fully resolve, so playing this one takes on the vibe of appointment viewing for anyone in your chat looking to piece the tale together.The Outlast TrialsPlatforms: PC, Xbox Series X|S, PS5Fresh off a major update, The Outlast Trials remains one of my favorite multiplayer horror games. For nearly two years, this was a four-player co-op take on the traditional Outlast formula (running from massive, often naked, killers brandishing sharp objects). It did its duty quite well in that regard, but the recent Invasion update adds a PvP twist to the game, letting you invade the ongoing missions of other teams, turning it into a blood-soaked 4v4 game of deception and stalking. Plus, earlier this year, the team at Red Barrels graciously added a nudity filter to make the game more streamer-friendly. Now the only things you'll see swinging are axes and knives.Hunt: Showdown 1896Platforms: PC, Xbox Series X|S, PS5The way I've long described Hunt: Showdown 1896 is "a game I love despite being bad at it." It's an extraction shooter set in a horror-western world with some of the best character and environmental artwork you'll find, whether you're comparing it to multiplayer games or horror games. It's a standout in either bucket. It can be intimidating, but if you're worried about being bad, don't sweat it. Watching good players play Hunt on stream has helped me immensely. Generally, I find this is always a helpful tip with multiplayer games you're trying to break into: Just watch the game's community tackle it live in front of you.PhasmophobiaPlatforms: PC, Xbox Series X|S, PS5Phasmophobia first exploded onto the scene in 2020 during the first Halloween in the COVID era. It was a great alternative for the many people who felt the effects of a stranger-than-usual Halloween that fall. But it has persisted as a major multiplayer horror hit since then, and today it remains one of the most beloved multiplayer horror games to stream or watch. Each round sends up to four players into a haunted house, school, prison, or other locale where one of 24 different types of ghosts have taken up residence. It's the players' job to identify the type of ghost and escape with everyone still alive in the end. The mix of laughter and terror in Phasmophobia is nearly unrivaled, and the game is moving through early access and adding new things all the time.REPOPlatforms: PC We say Phasmophobia is nearly unrivaled, because REPO sure does a great job of offering something a bit similar. More closely linked to Lethal Company in its gameplay loop, REPO sends four goofy little capsule-looking characters into haunted spaces, where they must remove valuables and turn them in for a profit. The game's physics system combines with a laundry list of different monsters with their own habits and abilities, which gives each round a level of unpredictability that makes REPO an obvious candidate for the best horror games on Twitch. This game went viral in early 2025 and with a big Halloween update just about to drop, you can expect another surge in players and viewers soon.Amnesia: The BunkerPlatforms: PC, Xbox Series X|S, PS5 Each Amnesia game is at least quite good in its own right, but for streamers, The Bunker is the best of them. That's because its unscripted monster roams the dark corridors of a World War I bunker, hunting for you out while you're tucked into a cupboard or tiptoeing to the safe room, trying not to make a sound. Each time you play the game, vital quest items change their locations, so every run is different. That kind of variety makes for a great streaming candidate, which is only enhanced by just how scary and atmospheric it all is. Whether you're playing for a speedrun, a no-damage run, or maybe just trying to stir the monster into a frenzy, there are a lot of ways to approach this one for your next stream.

title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Had The Biggest Physical Game Launch In Years In US

body:

The pocket monsters lead to money in Nintendo's pockets.By 
    Evan Campbell
   on October 27, 2025 at 10:09AM PDT 1 Comments
              
          
                It's been almost two-and-a-half years since a video game has made as big of a splash at US retail as Pokemon Legends: Z-A. A new report states the RPG put up unit and dollar sales for a boxed game that haven't been seen since The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom in May 2023.Circana's Mat Piscatella pointed out Pokemon Legends: Z-A's "massive US launch at retail" on BlueSky. This comes just days after The Pokemon Company announced the game had sold 5.8 millions copies in its first week. Piscatella did note that the US figures don't include copies bundled with Switch 2.Pokémon Legends: Z-A had a massive US launch at retail. Launch week physical unit and dollar sales of Pokémon Legends: Z-A were the biggest for a new physical video game launch since The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom back in May of 2023. Source: Circana Retail Tracking Service  — Mat Piscatella (@matpiscatella.bsky.social) October 27, 2025 at 11:03 AM
  The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom sold over 10 million copies in three days when the game was released in 2023. That matches what Pokemon Scarlet and Violet sold in late 2022--and is also still the best debut ever for the RPG series. Earlier this year, The Pokemon Company revealed that the Pokemon franchise has sold almost half-a-billion video games.Pokemon Legends: Z-A came out October 16 for Switch and Switch 2. The game will get paid DLC called Mega Dimension in the future. For more, check out GameSpot's Pokemon Legends: Z-A review. We also have a guides hub to assist trainers as they explore Lumiose City.Pokemon Legends: Z-A Full Pokedex - All Pokemon And Where To Find ThemSee More

title: Funko Pop Has Some Great Advent Calendars Just In Time For The Holidays
description: By     Brendan Hesse   and     Myles Obenza   on October 27, 2025 at 2:59PM PDT                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this...
body:
By 
    Brendan Hesse
   and 
    Myles Obenza
   on October 27, 2025 at 2:59PM PDT    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Halloween is almost here, which means the Winter holidays are fast approaching. In anticipation of the festive season, Funko recently launched four new Funko Holiday Countdown Calendars for 2025. Each calendar includes an assortment of between 12 - 24 mystery figures based on popular franchises to help you track the final weeks until Christmas. One of the new sets is the Funko Pop Countdown Calendar: The Nightmare Before Christmas, which includes 24 Funko Pocket Pop figures from the classic Tim Burton stop-motion film. The box set is on sale for $42.49 (was $50).The other three new Funko Holiday Countdown Calendars feature collectible Bitty Pop figures from Marvel Comics, Lilo & Stitch, and Disney Princesses. All three 24-day Advent calendars are available now for $25 each.Beyond these new 2025 releases, many of the Funko Pocket Pop Holiday Countdown Calendars from previous years are also in stock and available now, each with themes like Stranger Things, to Star Wars, and even Five Nights at Freddy's. There's also the Simpsons: Treehouse of Horror 13-day calendar, which is perfect Halloween, and worth grabbing at the end of this year's spooky season. Check below for full rundowns of all of the Funko Holiday Calendars available now.Regardless of which calendar theme you prefer, each one comes with exclusive Funko Pocket Pop or Bitty Pop figures--both of which are much smaller than the standard Funko vinyl figures. Funko Pocket Pops stand between 1-2 inches tall, while Bitty Pops are all under one inch.Funko Bitty Pop Marvel Comics 24-Day Countdown Calendar$35The colorful Marvel Comics calendar features Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Who you get is a mystery, but expect to reveal characters like:Black PantherVisionWar MachineLokiBlack PantherFunko Bitty Pop Disney's Stitch 24-Day Countdown Calendar$35Disney's Stitch calendar features the titular Experiment 626 in an adorable Santa costume. It also comes with a model of Lilo's house, so you can place and pose your figures however you like. Here's what else you can get:LiloSuperhero StitchStitch and the Red OneFunko Bitty Pop Disney Princess 24-Day Countdown Calendar$35The iconic Disney Princesses come with an intricate Cinderella's Castle display shelf for the small figures. Available princess figures include:BelleRapunzelTianaJasmineMoanaFunko Pocket Pop The Nightmare Before Christmas 24-Day Countdown Calendar$42.49 ($50)The Nightmare Before Christmas calendar makes perfect sense given the subject matter of the film. You get an awesome Jack Skellington in his Santa suit figure, and some of the other figures you get are deep cuts if you're a longtime fan. Here are some of the other figures available:SallyZeroShockFunko Pocket Pop Pokemon 24-Day Countdown Calendar $45 ($50)The Pokemon calendar is one I'd definitely pick up as a lifelong fan. The Eevee figure is adorable, and they included my favorite Pokemon: Dragonite. You can also find:PikachuLucarioLaprasUmbreonPiplupFunko Pocket Pop Stranger Things 24-Day Countdown Calendar $57With the final season of Stranger Things around the corner, this is the perfect calendar to use to celebrate both its release and the holidays. The Vecna figure with Santa hat is great, as well. This kit also includes:LucasEddie MunsonHenry CreelFunko Pocket Pop Star Wars 24-Day Countdown Calendar$50Each figure depicts our favorite characters with fun holiday twists. The red candy can Darth Vader is a unique twist on his black armor. You can also find:Snowman StormtrooperElf Luke SkywalkerWinter LeiaFunko Pocket Pop Harry Potter 24-Day Countdown Calendar$53.69Folks have argued for ages about whether the Harry Potter films are best enjoyed during Halloween or the holidays. Funko answers that question with this themed calendar. This kit features some iconic characters:Harry PotterRon WeasleyHermione GrangerDraco MalfoyFunko Pocket Pop Disney Pixar 24-Day Countdown Calendar $50Your favorite Pixar characters also get the Christmas treatment with unique and exclusive figures. Included in this box are:WoodyJesseSullyWall-EFunko Pocket Pop Five Night's at Freddy's 24-Day Countdown Calendar $50The Five Nights At Freddy's calendar has holiday twists of the creepy animatronics like many of the other calendars. Along with Freddy Fazbear, you can get:Chica the ChickenBalloraFoxyFunko Pocket Pop Disney 24-Day Countdown Calendar $54.61Nobody does the holidays quite like Mickey and friends, and this calendar is the perfect way to get some Christmas-themed figures. Aside from the iconic mouse, you can also get holiday versions of:Minnie MouseDonald DuckPlutoWinnie the PoohFunko Pocket Pop The Simpsons Treehouse of Horror 13-Day Countdown Calendar $35The time for this one this year may have passed, with Halloween just a few days away, but it's a great pick up for next year to countdown to spooky season. You'll be able to find:Zombie BartVampire LisaGrim Reaper HomerFunko Pocket Pop Marvel 12-Day Countdown Calendar $26.69The shortest calendar on this list, the Christmas tree Groot figure is adorable and a great way to showcase this collection. Also available are: WolverineShe-HulkSpider-Man
